thread.title: CORRECTED- rise decline in U.S. stocks

author: cnbc.com
title: CORRECTED- rise decline in U.S. stocks
text:
(Corrects headline and second bullet to show U.S. crude stocks declined; deletes reference to outdated comment by OPEC's Barkindo)
* Global stock market recovery also supports crude oil futures
* API says U.S. crude inventories fell by 1.1 million barrels
* But falling seasonal demand, soaring U.S. output are looming
* The U.S. shale revolution: http://tmsnrt.rs/2EtJgen
SINGAPORE, Feb 7 (Reuters) -   week.
 
 
 
"Evidence points to a global inventory market that has arguably already balanced   production <C-OUT-T-EIA>,  
By 2019, the EIA says U.S. crude production will rise to 11.18 million bpd. That would be more than top producer Russia, which pumped on average 10.98 million bpd out of the ground in 2017.
(Reporting by Henning Gloystein; editing by Richard Pullin)
